channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Russia walked out of a Security Council meeting after EU officials blamed Moscow for global food crisis https://t.co/8yaktPPBYk

Thousands of workers in the U.K. are beginning a four-day workweek this week, one of the largest tests to date of whether employees can accomplish just as much—for the same pay—in fewer hours https://t.co/WOFIiwAOD3

A teenager with Down syndrome escaped besieged Mariupol as his mother wove a motivational fantasy that John Cena lay at the end of their dangerous journey out of Ukraine. The fantasy ended with a happy reality. https://t.co/2VNo30ELpQ
An estimated 200,000 children of immigrants on work visas don’t have a clear legal path to stay in the U.S. once they turn 21 https://t.co/1nQU59JbPy
Target warned profits would drop this year because it bought too many goods. It's the latest sign of the sudden supply-and-demand mismatch at U.S. stores https://t.co/rHK52T77uB
Desertions. Refusing orders. Moscow has a military problem on its hands. https://t.co/qcdxNuPj6U

The company that makes Tasers is scrapping plans to develop drones to incapacitate mass shooters after nine of the 13 members of its ethics advisory board resigned over objection to the project https://t.co/qP7O6M8eyl
Our reporter drove from New Orleans to Chicago and back to test the feasibility of taking a road trip in an EV. She wouldn’t do it again soon. https://t.co/WrxIS2HWJW

Former Proud Boys leader Enrique Tarrio and four other members of the far-right group have been indicted on seditious conspiracy charges in connection with the U.S. Capitol riot https://t.co/MN8Pll6mDN
Boris Johnson survived a no-confidence vote, but the margin of victory suggests the U.K. prime minister's hold on the Conservative Party remains tenuous https://t.co/hZghIo73y1

Brazil has ordered a Navy search team to scour a remote corner of the Amazon rainforest near Peru Monday, after British journalist Dom Phillips went missing with one of the country’s top indigenous experts https://t.co/0rhyelpmS2
Twitter is being investigated by the Texas attorney general over its number of fake accounts https://t.co/S57XLKyl5i
Our reporter drove from New Orleans to Chicago and back to test the feasibility of taking a road trip in an EV. She wouldn’t do it again soon. https://t.co/WwreScpAO1

Former Proud Boys leader Enrique Tarrio and four other members of the far-right group have been indicted on seditious conspiracy charges in connection with the U.S. Capitol riot https://t.co/W1AMFfsEc9
San Francisco District Attorney Chesa Boudin won office in 2019 promising radical change. Voters, fed up with crime, decide Tuesday if they still like the idea. https://t.co/yEXZsg35xT
Twitter is being investigated by the Texas attorney general over its number of fake accounts https://t.co/Ynsc794ziO

U.S. authorities filed documents to seize two planes owned by Russian oligarch Roman Abramovich, saying that the planes were manufactured in the U.S. and are subject to U.S. sanctions imposed in the wake of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/BpycUERDbj
The White House plans to waive some solar import tariffs to ensure supply while invoking the Defense Production Act to boost domestic manufacturing https://t.co/R4160EjHfL
A new study of an AstraZeneca breast-cancer drug showed it cut the risk of tumor progression by half for people with the most advanced form of the disease https://t.co/JqkGB46b2g
Breaking: Elon Musk threatened to end his deal to buy Twitter, accusing the company of not complying with his request for data on its spam and fake accounts https://t.co/U4d9XMyAX1
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/G7fxGNp1Lv https://t.co/0zMgmyuOWO

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky visited the front lines of the fighting in the eastern Luhansk region, miles from where a Russian general was killed, highlighting the shifting military situation in the area https://t.co/vdkVgBizAJ
After Disney’s recent battles Florida lawmakers, tens of thousands of visitors are heading to Disney World for an unofficial gathering of LGBT parkgoers known as Gay Day https://t.co/XUv3ZWPuwg
Bosses reward people who speak up in meetings. How can you avoid passing over the quietly productive? Behavioral economist Dan Ariely has the answers. https://t.co/m3Dc2Ot7Q1

In the 100 days since Russia launched a full-scale war on Ukraine, the death and destruction continues with no end in sight. From casualties and refugees to poverty and sanctions, here is a look at key metrics measuring the devastation. https://t.co/qhoVEAVgsY

One of China’s biggest online influencers stepped on a political land mine while promoting an ice-cream product, sparking a wave of curiosity about the 1989 Tiananmen Square crackdown https://t.co/7ceCI1Phfp
Desertions. Refusing orders. Moscow has a military problem on its hands. https://t.co/PZOeox8ENr
The developer of the American Dream mega mall in New Jersey has failed to make its semiannual interest payment on an $800 million municipal bond https://t.co/lZGz2023iv
The U.S. won’t impose new tariffs on solar imports for two years, in a move aimed at reviving stalled solar power projects, people familiar say https://t.co/OzJvcCu1Rs
Queen Elizabeth II’s limited appearances at her jubilee celebration—with her son standing in for her—serves as a template for the final chapter of her reign https://t.co/lkpl8NynaD

Daniel Enriquez’s family left New York during a crime wave in 1980, but he moved back in the 1990s. Last month, the Goldman Sachs worker was shot and killed by a stranger on the subway: “He came back, and it cost him his life." https://t.co/mFK0jqp77b
Queen Elizabeth II’s limited appearances at her jubilee celebration—with her son standing in for her—serves as a template for the final chapter of her reign https://t.co/ZgqRlVB1PQ
“Top Gun: Maverick” flew high again at the domestic box office this weekend with one of the strongest second-week performances ever https://t.co/c4foO6f0e4

Gunmen killed dozens of worshipers, including children, in a shooting at a Sunday church service in southwestern Nigeria, in the latest example of spiraling religious violence in Africa’s most populous nation https://t.co/Gcf2brN4f4

Ukraine’s farms are expected to produce around 30 million tons of wheat, corn and other food commodities this year, and they are seeking alternative routes to export those grains to stave off global food shortages. https://t.co/SY7mxfLwz9
From @WSJopinion: "Top Gun: Maverick” crushed box-office debut records over Memorial Day weekend, and it’s worth asking why https://t.co/e8MwPYv0K4

After Russia’s blockade of Black Sea routes, Ukraine is looking for alternative shipping options to help stave off global food shortages. The endeavor, however, is far from straightforward. https://t.co/R8IJJvDpVY

The number of children dying by suicide has risen dramatically in recent years, leaving parents and experts searching for explanations: “I’m never going to make any sense of it." https://t.co/HakyeQ7b3I
Elon Musk’s battle with bots on Twitter is personal: One estimate says spam, fake or inactive accounts make up the vast majority of his 95 million followers. https://t.co/bjamuON7PS
The developer of the American Dream mega mall in New Jersey has failed to make its semiannual interest payment on an $800 million municipal bond https://t.co/UCxDgBTXVb

One of China’s biggest online influencers stepped on a political land mine while promoting an ice-cream product, sparking a wave of curiosity about the 1989 Tiananmen Square crackdown https://t.co/BXGpE4GDJE
From @WSJopinion: The Durham jury convicts the FBI. In the Russiagate case, it seems the agency wanted to be lied to, writes @HolmanJenkins. https://t.co/HJdMpSMNUG

Daniel Enriquez’s family left New York during a crime wave in 1980, but he moved back in the 1990s. Last month, the Goldman Sachs worker was shot and killed by a stranger on the subway: “He came back, and it cost him his life." https://t.co/dUskd0VYAg
Rafael Nadal has won the French Open for the 14th time, defeating Casper Ruud, securing his 22nd Grand Slam title https://t.co/tmi2PRDSJf
The global energy trade is turning into a geopolitical contest that will drive up the costs of oil and gas for much of the world. https://t.co/URj5d0SLoS
Ukrainian forces have retaken parts of Severodonetsk, boosting hopes they can hold off the Russian offensive in Donbas as Kyiv awaits long-range rocket systems from the U.S. https://t.co/8Hhz8n7saj
The number of U.S. residents in Portugal climbed by 45% last year. Here's what to know about why so many Americans are making the country their home base. https://t.co/1xFFr4kv7B
Congratulations, you've hired someone to fill that open job. Next challenge is to get that person to actually show up. https://t.co/GbB0F2675O
Soccer player Alex Morgan and other female stars are taking control over their financial destinies. “We’ve been undervalued as athletes our whole lives.” https://t.co/gu9Hw0w9uS
When a customer is angry, hearing them out is the most important thing. Don’t be too quick to jump in with an explanation or even offer a fix. https://t.co/SmPNtImhY4
